website_summaries.verdict: You can skip flouring this nonstick springform pan. Just give it a light greasing and you're ready to go.
pros: Springform buckle for easy release of baked goods
No need to flour the pan, but lightly grease for best results
cons: It leaks in some cases, so be sure you have a thick recipe

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I have made several cheesecakes in the iPot ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have made several cheesecakes in the iPot pressure cooker with the springform pan and they have turned out very well except for the first one when I overfilled it and had a big mess. The springform releases easily and the pan cleanup is quick and easy. It makes a small but delicious cheesecake.....just don't overfill it. I might get another pan so as to make two cheesecakes at once with a trivet between them.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of teenagers

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this pan! I used it to make a cheesecake in my instantpot (6 Quart). First time ever doing that. I am new to the instantpot cooking, so I was pretty nervous. It came out perfect! My daughter who isn't a huge fan of cheesecake loved it! I heard a lot of people talking about leaking pans. I was worried but no leaks here. I can't wait to make more things
customer_reviews.author: Angie from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Technically works for Instant Pot lasagna, but it's a tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: Technically works for Instant Pot lasagna, but it's a tight fit. Doing 3 layers of lasagna in this pan pushed it to the limit on top. I had to push the precooked lasagna down to ensure it wouldn't fall over the sides during cooking. This is 2.3 inches high, and I'm buying another springform that's 2.99 inches to see if the end results are better. It does cook lasagna and it was tasty, but a I'll look to use a taller pan to ensure I don't have to smoosh anything down.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a 7" springform in a store and this is exactly what I was looking for! Nonstick, and fit perfectly in my Instant Pot for cheesecake!
customer_reviews.author: EFMARIE

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Springform cake pans are a tried-and-true utensil. Pressure cookers are as well. Now, take a modern pressure cooker like the Instant Pot and use it with a springform cake pan and you get a great way to make a nice dessert or specialty bread quickly and with ingredients you can trust (because you bought them yourself). This company even followed up with a detailed email about their warranty and customer satisfaction policies, which I certainly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Sientz

customer_reviews.title: I really wonder if the designers of this pan has ever baked a cheesecake.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the pan is designed wrong. The lip on the bottom section almost forces you to install it in the ring with the lip going up... rather than down. This will inevitably force you to destroy your cheese cake getting it out of the pan. I have been baking 9" cheesecakes for years... probably hundreds of them... I give them as gifts... I baked them for my daughter's wedding... church dinners... fund raisers... etc.. I decided to switch to 10" cakes because all of the shipping containers to send them frozen by USPS are for 10" cakes... and my 9" pans were worn out. I would recommend you keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Leaked on first Use
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive this and use it as it was billed as "Leakproof". Came quickly, beautiful looking etc.... I Made a fairly thick mixture, with eggs, cream, veggies...etc...put it in the Springform and...it leaked. Very disappointed. Not worth sending sending back though. Maybe I just got a bad one. I'll try contacting the seller to see what's up.
customer_reviews.author: Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Rusty springform pans
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these thinking that it will be a great addition for making cheese cakes. Found out that it rust just after 1 wash of soap and warm water. Edit: Adding 1 star to the original rating because their customer service however was top notch. They were prompt and helpful. Offered a refund right away without the hassle of returning. I wished it didn’t rust.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick coating peeling after only 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: After only 2 uses, and gentle cleaning, the non-stick coating is coming off. It is peeling off in spots, and elewhere the base metal is showing through. I'll be throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: aerlys

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-size springform pan! Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: We used this on the most difficult, sticky, recipe we have (Oreo salted caramel pie) and it came out perfectly! It released from the pan with minimal help and washed off easily. The pan came with a scratch-free scrubber cloth, but we didn't even need that. You have to be careful to align the bottom into the grooves. It can appear to be closed and not have a good seal, but if you align it correctly it makes a tight and perfect waterproof seal. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KatByrne

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after one use!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this and after one use it started leaking. Got it replaced, attempted to use it for my instant pot flan and it begun leaking. NOT EVEN ONE USE OUT OF IT. Seller is super nice and helpful, but at this point, I am frustrated. Definitely didn't get a bad batch.. It just isn't good quality. If anyone got a second or third use, please let me know. I definitely didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Hizies

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the IP Duo 6QT!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for making a lasagna in my 6qt Instant Pot Duo! I lowered the pan into the pot on the steam rack. Unlatched the pan when done and the pan separated from the food with no issue. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: ItsMoreFunOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed... Trust the reviews. This product leaks. Also it is very small. I would measure if I were you prior to buying so you have full awareness before purchasing. Compared to my 8 quart.. so small. I was willing to get over that though, but I cannot have leaky cheese cake. Hope the return is as easy as it sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want a grease fire! Ack!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this pan. My mother-in-law and I couldn’t figure out why my oven was smoking, and then we discovered grease on the bottom of the oven bc it leaked everywhere! It took forever to get my fire alarm to go off. Once we covered it in foil to keep the grease in the pan, it baked fine. But this was just an awful experience!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Crimped in metal at Closure! :(
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this purchase! I started to open the pan to put the parchment in to use it and it crimped at the closure part! I had waited to get this pan to use with my new Air fryer! Disappointed is an understatement! :( No, it leaks!!!! bad!!! It was crimped at the closure and I tried to use it tonight ti see if could bake a cake! It doesn't work!My clean oven is ruined! I do NOT want a replacement. Thank you for trying but NO Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice springform pan for my InstantPot mini!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this is my first experience with a springform pan. It fits perfectly in my 3-quart InstantPot, so that is good! I used it with a silicone sling to help with the removal and that went well. The pan did, however, leak a bit, but I am not sure it wasn’t my fault, as in not snapping it together well enough. Next time I use it, I will wrap the bottom in foil, just in case. It went through the dishwasher and still had a bit of food debris in the groove that holds the bottom on, so I am giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Drama

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Instant Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheesecake pan that would fit in my Instant Pot. This one fits great, with a little room around it to allow for the steaming effect. Although I haven't tried it yet, it seems to be good enough quality and the bottom locks into place easily. I can't wait to try it. This was the most reasonably priced pan of this size I could find, so I highly recommend it if you're looking for a small pan. Also, it came with a nice cleaning cloth as a bonus, which was a nice surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S. Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan on October 30, 2019 and it broke yesterday, April 30 2020. The rivets holding the latch in place popped out when I released the spring tension. I would have hoped this lasted longer than six months. I can’t imagine that I used it more than 15 times. I only made cheesecakes with it in an Instapot.
customer_reviews.author: BB-8

customer_reviews.title: Identical to included pan for Instant Pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great springform pan for making various cakes. It is very sturdy and looks exactly the same as the pan that came in my instant pot duo crisp. I have baked several cakes in it and the non-stick coating cleans very nicely after use. Overall I am very happy with my purchase and highly recommend this compared to the price of the "official" instant pot pans
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Thought if was a big bigger !
customer_reviews.text: My wife would like to do a cheesecake and bought this item. She was a little bit disappointed when she opened the box but we did not return the item. She did the Cheesecake. It was delicious BTW. She wants to remain with this item and maybe we will buy a bigger one in the future. She thought it was a little bit to easy to separate the part and was a bit afraid with leaking. At the end all went well ! Summary is: if you want a little 7" cheesecake pan and have in mind that 7" is not big, so go ahead, this product is good
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Fructus

customer_reviews.title: Great pan... but it rusted after 2 uses!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pan 2 times now. I have no complaint as to its performance, but rather the rust that I found on it after the 2nd use. I did not put it in the dishwasher and instead hand washed. Today, I notice a line of rust forming within the lip on the bottom of the pan. Not the flat part that the cake sits on, but the ring that holds the sides in. Im really disappointed in this because I have had great results cooking with it. However, I cannot tolerate rust build up after 2 uses, and this surely cannot be good/healthy to cook with upon rust formation.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: Made an egg fritatta and it leaked like a sieve. Luckily, we were able to salvage the mixture and make it in a frying pan. This is going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Gardenista

customer_reviews.title: I can't say it's non-stick. Made a cake out ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't say it's non-stick. Made a cake out of it and sticked to the top to bottom. And then i was astonished to find another one, 9 inch only $5 which I bought from Walmart, to be perfectly non-stick, with my same recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Li Tian

customer_reviews.title: Still worth it. I'd buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my cheesecake that I made in my instant pot. It fit in my 6qt,but was a little difficult to get out while hot. It lifted off perfect and didn't leak the batter or anything, but after I handwashed it, I guess I didn't get every drop of water and when I flipped it over after I thought it was completely air dried I saw a drop of water fall out of the crease and was brown from rust. Make sure you wipe down right after washing to prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality pan - additional update
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far. No problem then. Have high hopes. I can say it’s well made, And will probably get another as I bake a lot of cheesecakes to sale. _________________________________________ It’s now been six cakes later in a two week period and I now can truthfully say that I am in love with this pan. No leakage!! Wilton’s pan let me down in the past. So needless to say, I wanted to let fellow home bakers know, this is the reliability you have been in need of. I’m ordering another one! Oh in case you didn’t know, the company extends the warranty pass Amazon’s to a two year warranty on their pan!
customer_reviews.author: viveee

customer_reviews.title: Nonstick Coating after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made three cheesecakes and the nonstick coating is peeling already. Initially i was excited, but now I’m highly disappointed in the pan. I have to wrap with foil in order to contain anything seeping out from the bottom. Overall I am disappointed in the product. I’ll need to buy a new springform, as I cannot trust the coating not to come off into our food.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Works well in the Mealthy MultiPot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to make a lemon cheesecake and french toast bread pudding in the Mealthy MultiPot. I did not notice any leaking with either item, and it was easy to lift the items from the pan. I have used it with and without non-stick spray, and there was not inordinate sticking either time. The batter does get stuck in the ridges, and it is hard to get out. I directed a hard spray with the hand sprayer to try to get out the dug-in batter. This is the reason for the one star deducted.
customer_reviews.author: Amity

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works well in my InstantPot, but I really wish the sides were taller to compensate for its small size
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for cooking/ baking in my InstantPot, and it fits just fine in my 6qt with room to spare, but I do wish, for how small it is compared to typical sized spring form, that the sides were taller. When first opening it, my 9 year old got excited and thought it was a kids play pan for her old play kitchen, because it is pretty small. The couple of things I've tried to use it for have expanded a couple of inches and spilled over the short sides. As far as spring form pans go, however, this one seems to be good quality and doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Not 8" not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: I pulled this out of the box and said to myself this isn't eight inches. I measured and the inside diameter is 7 5/8" not 8". I also washed it before first use, to test it I filled it with water and it came running out the bottom. I will keep it just learn to deal with the issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It works, but batter gets stuck in odd crevices when you open it up to clean
customer_reviews.text: This came with wax paper that may or may not have helped. I've used it once, but the pan plate has a hollow pipe that goes around the pan with some kind of vent holes in it. Batter seeped in and then baked into cake, and the shape of the vent doesn't lend itself to cleaning very easily, even with pipe cleaners, so this pan permanently contains cake. The non-stick worked great, and the cake came out like a snap, but the idea of each cake adding some residual inside the pan is gross.
customer_reviews.author: calvim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little pan!
customer_reviews.text: It's just so darned cute! It fits my 3 qt Instant Pot perfectly, it makes just the right size cheesecake for two people, it clasps and unclasps very easily, and the no stick surface of the entire thing makes clean up a breeze. I have a feeling my larger spring form pans will wind up pushed to the back of the cabinet!
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth (Liz) Thacker

customer_reviews.title: It fits perfect in my 6 quart instant pot
customer_reviews.text: I received my pan less than a week ago and I've made a cheesecake so far. It fits perfect in my 6 quart instant pot. It worked great and came through the dishwasher perfect. Good price too! Only regret is that I didn't order two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoprime

customer_reviews.title: This pan does in fact leak
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for some special treats over the holidays, one being a pigs in the blanket pull apart wreath. It leaked the fluid all over the oven and filled the house with smoke. Bought this particular pan, as it was advertised as leak proof. Not so~
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: 10" spring form pan
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 2 stars. One because it does leak and one for the sheet liners. I wanted to like this but was disappointed. The base was not flat as it should be and could be the reason it leaked so much. It does lock in place but since the base isn't flat, it didn't help. I made a regular cake and a cheesecake and put a pan beneath them each time. I was surprised at how much leaked out the bottom. It also had a strange oily coating on it when it arrived that I was able to scrub off. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Good for pressure cooker cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with what I bought it for. #1 Cheesecake in the the pressure cooker came out fine. I did run a plastic knife around the edges before I released the latch. I also made a small carrot cake with pineapple and juice in the oven. I put it on a cookie sheet and it did leak a little bit. I don't think a spring form pan is intended to make wet cakes. It will rust if you don't dry it completely. I shake the ring until water stops coming out of the overlap.
customer_reviews.author: Mich123

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Springform Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size for cheesecakes. I still have to double wrap this pan in aluminum foil to prevent leaks. It is NOT leak proof!! I securely closed the latched and poured water into it. Dripped right out. The finish is also very easy to scratch. I used a knife to carefully remove the cake and it instantly scratched the cheap black paint off. Still- for the price, it gets the job done. My cheesecakes came out great. But I wouldn’t say it’s high-quality or leak-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Dinh

customer_reviews.title: It fits and they care
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product mainly to make cheesecake in my Instant Pot 6-quart Pressure cooker. It fits perfectly and performs as advertised. I love it when things fit and work as advertised. Customer service contacted me by email to make sure everything is okay and if it wasn't they would make sure they would take care of it to my satisfaction, not theirs. That's a terrific customer follow up. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sgurgola

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these pans to bake cakes and the first time I used it they were great. When I used them a second time it was a disaster. The cake batter started to leak out from all three pans. I had to rush to try and transfer all of the batter into separate bowls. The springform didn't seem to close tight enough leaving a small gap at the bottom, where the latch is, and the batter leaked out. The ring is also not sturdy enough and easily bends, not retaining it's circular shape. I HIGHLY suggest purchasing another springform pan instead of this one, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Akpop

customer_reviews.title: Knock out a small cheese cake in no time all all ..
customer_reviews.text: I have nade 2 cheese cakes since i got this last week. 1 in the instapot and one in my air fryer toaster over, the toaster over was much better. Thing to remember is people, stainless steel does not rust, this will, but if you take care of it it wont rust, i.e no dish washer. Hand wash only and once i am done hand washing it, i put it in the oven at 200 degrees for 3 mins to dry it out, just remember a magnet will not still to stainless steel if you are unsure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits together real well
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but haven't had a chance to use it. Just by feel I can tell it will be easy to clean. The recipe I wanted to use also recommends a circle of parchment paper underneath the batter. The clamp works really well to release the bottom and it is easy to put back together. The trip to my daughter's to bake a cheesecake together was cancelled due to snow and ice. Gotta love Nebraska weather.
customer_reviews.author: RudysMom

customer_reviews.title: 5 star customer service
customer_reviews.text: The pan worked excellent,just as advertised, but it did leak a little bit in the bottom of the pressure cooker. The seller contacted me to see how I liked the pan, I sent a picture were I thought the pan leaked and they sent a refund immediately. I didn't even have to ask. 5 star customer service and no I didn't get this at a discount.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I added this pan to my collection of springform pans for my favorite cheesecakes. It is sturdy and the coating makes it easy to remove cake. Make sure you insert the bottom correctly so that the flat side not the recessed side is inside. Otherwise, the cake is difficult to serve and the crumb crust is list. I made this error the first time I used it although I am an experience spring form pan user.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pan
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time last night and it worked excellently. The spring is tight enough to hold the base properly without being too hard to engage. There was a bit of what was probably the cooking spray I used that ended up on the bottom of the pan after the cheesecake was finished but the cheesecake itself stayed in just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Leaked!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this pan. The reviews were good so maybe I just got a dud. I did the water test and it leaked like the bottom wasn’t closed properly. I tried it several times and each time I redid the lock. I also decided to try a cheesecake. That was a disaster. Glad I had foil all around it because that’s where the filling was. On the outside of the pan. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Used this for ice box cake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to make an ice box cake and it worked out tremendously. I couldn't be happier. I've never used a product like this before and I found it extremely easy. The surface is non-stick therefore it's easy to clean. When it was time to pull the ring off the cake it was a smooth transition. I will sing this pan's praises to anyone who will listen.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Fits my electric pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use. It did not leak. The cheesecake released from the pan completely. I used it in my electric pressure cooker. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Carr

customer_reviews.title: sides are smaller then I realized
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased 1 at a big store for daughter made by InstantPot & it had high sides. I thought this would be the same but the sides are only 1/2 the height of hers. I don't think any are really leak proof. This one has a constant small leak in the same place each time but I just put foil under it. If I can ever shop again I' ll get a replacement & give this away
customer_reviews.author: Joyce K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cakes every time!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this little guy practically every week. It's the perfect size if you're just making a small cake for yourself or for a handful of friends, and when it says "nonstick," it really does mean *nonstick*. I've used it for the stickiest batter I can make, and the cake slid right out, no greasing required! (But just in case, the pan also comes with a cute little cloth to wipe off any crumbs, which I've had to use once between layers.) It's also sturdy, and so far, after a few uses with hand-washing between each one, I haven't seen a single spot of rust. In short, definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: springform pan makes fabulous homemade brownie
customer_reviews.text: I really was excited how the Insta Pot brownie turned out in the springform pan. After you make the brownie in this cute pan, you cover it with foil to keep the water away from the brownie. After brownie cools in the pan you take the outer walls off and the brownie is sitting on the bottom base with ease and cut the brownie on the base. The brownie was very chocolately. My family loved the brownie, I will make it often
customer_reviews.author: Vicki M. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Pan rusts, leaks; Coating peeling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with intent of making lasagna in the instant pot and cakes in the oven. First use, the coating was scratched with use of a silicone utensil. We should have thrown it out then, but we continued to use it for cakes. Third use with cakes, we noticed a layer of black substance by the edge of the pan. We thought the cake was burnt. Turned out to be rust from the pan. The pan was rusting at the base INSIDE the rounded edges. We are tossing the pan and we HIGHLY recommend buying elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for Instant Pot. Purchased to make the New York cheesecake #17. The cheesecake is delicious and the pan worked so well I purchased two more for gifts for friends who have Instant Pots. I recommend drying immediately after washing so you don’t have water spots or get rust over time. I haven’t had any issues with this pan but I have in the past with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: ABK

customer_reviews.title: Latch broke after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: I had the pan for about 2 months and made a couple cheesecakes and lasagna's in the Instant Pot. The pan did leak a bit, so I used foil to seal the bottom. The coating was starting to scratch already. But the final straw was the latch bolts just pulled right out of the pan when I was trying to open it (see picture). Can't open it now - going to have to eat this cheesecake right out of the pan with a spoon :) Admittedly the pan wasn't expensive and I didn't expect it to last forever, but I really DO NOT recommend this particular pan.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: leaky
customer_reviews.text: leaks pretty badly, but I can make due using wax paper. I picked this one for the reviews but wish I'd just gone with a walmart one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Lee

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect sizing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an 8” tin. This looks like great quality but it’s not 8”, it’s only 7.5”. Why list an item as 8” when it’s not?? Edit: I bought a third...I know I should have known better! but my son wants to build a tiered cake so that means having a third! I bought exactly the same pan so that even if its not 8" at least it would be the same as the others..No...No, why would that be the case??????????? This one is 8 1/2 " so out by a full 1 inch. What sort of quality control is going on here??????? Ill soon have enough random bakeware to open my own store Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: None of these will hold water,
customer_reviews.text: But mine holds cake batter, no problem. I put a bit of firm coconut oil around the joints first, just to make sure, but I don't know if it was needed. Besides, no matter what you're cooking in it, a little coconut oil wouldn't be noticeable. I'm gonna make a lasagna in it next. If some juice does get out, that should be a good thing!
customer_reviews.author: W. Swanton

customer_reviews.title: Performed Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, but had absolutely no issues with the pan. I used it for cornbread, which is a bit sturdier batter than a cheesecake. Just in case, I placed it on a flat pan before baking. There was no leakage at all. Cornbread came out cleanly from the pan (I did use a paper bottom liner) and nothing stuck to the sides. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Marie

customer_reviews.title: “Leakproof” is a joke -_-
customer_reviews.text: “Leakproof” is a joke. There is a gap between the base and springform so batter would go straight through!
customer_reviews.author: DessertsWithBenefits

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the 8qt instant pot
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this springform pan for my 8qt instant pot. It was the perfect size! It wasn't too small, leaving too much unused space in the pot, then and also wasn't too tight of a fit. I made two cheesecakes it in and they turned out great. The buttered the bottom and sides, and didn't have the slightest sticking to the pan with it being non-stick. I didn't even bother with using parchment paper as the recipe suggested. The seal was tight and the hinge was very easy to use while keeping it tight.
customer_reviews.author: The Taylors

customer_reviews.title: My kitchen is covered in eggs, my family’s dinner is ruined.
customer_reviews.text: My first attempt at using this pan. I was making a frittata. When I lifted the pan to put in the cooker I discovered that there was egg all over my counter and floor. This thing leaks like crazy in is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Healing

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My springform pan was delivered quickly and I made the most amazing peanut butter cup cheesecake in my Instant Pot! The pan released easily and did not stick to my cheesecake. It was a breeze to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gatewood

customer_reviews.title: Stick-proof seal
customer_reviews.text: I made a triple citrus cheesecake. First time ever making a cheesecake and first time ever using a springform. I followed a recipe that did not remind me to use butter or oil spray on the pan before starting the baking! I thought my cheesecake was doomed. Somehow, my cheesecake popped out of the springform and the bottom has served as a plate of my cheesecake for now. I was so glad!! Yay for cheesecakes!
customer_reviews.author: twistally

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I have been making cheese cake for almost 50 years. I've used many pans over the years. My last pan was the Kaiser pan until it started to peel. I did not want to replace it as peeling seemed to be a universal problem. I took a chance and ordered the Hiware 10 in. Non-stick Springform Pan. OMG! this is the best pan I have ever had. My cheese cake is perfect. Thank You Hiware.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Ann

customer_reviews.title: FIts perfectly in my Instant Pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one specifically because it fits into my 6 qt instant pot and I can make cheesecake with it! It works great with a parchment paper liner (which were included!)
customer_reviews.author: A1CBeavis

customer_reviews.title: Great springform pan for my Ninja Foodi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan to use in my 6.5 Qt Ninja Foodi. It fits perfectly and works really well. It is solidly made, has not leaked so far, and is really easy to clean. I also really liked the additional cloth that the seller provided and that they make donations to "Save the Children." Great reasons to buy from them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my Ninja Foodi 6.5 qt
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my Ninja Foodi 6.5 qt - fits perfectly. I have only used for cornbread and a skillet cookie so far and neither batters leaked. The non-stick coating works well, although I did still spray with cooking spray. I used a parchment round on the bottom before filling and was able to slide the cornbread and cookie right off the bottom onto a plate.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I received the 7 inch spring form pan yesterday and immediately set to making cheesecake in my instant pot. As it cooled, it came away from the sides of the pan by itself and it also came loose from the bottom very easily when I went to cut it and serve it after it cooled in the fridge for a few hours. I’ll probably never make cheesecake any other way again!
customer_reviews.author: Peonie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. Comes with a cleaning cloth too
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Comes with a cleaning cloth too. I made the best little keto cheesecake in here the night I got it and it was perfect. Fits perfectly in the instant pot 6 quart allowing the the trivet handles to come up along the outside of it to easily remove when it is done cooking.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS :(
customer_reviews.text: So excited to get this product. Used for the first time to make a beautiful frittata in the instant pot. Leaked raw eggs all over even though pan was assembled correctly. Took it apart and tested with water. Leaks! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Doxiemom

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK BUT
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item about six time to make a cheese cakes in Intant Pot. Always washed them by hand in mild detergent and a sponge, last use the non-stick finish started to peal off, I would not recomend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: PhilVal

customer_reviews.title: Worked nicely
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a cinnamon bun casserole in my instant pot. Worked wonderfully and easy to remove without any negative results. Only thing I would tell people is if you're getting it for instant pot and you don't have a lifted base to set it on it will not fit perfectly in the instant pot. But if you use a lifted base it fits like a glove
customer_reviews.author: Morgan McGowan, MS

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to fit my Instant Pot Max to make a cheese bake, the cake turned out perfect and it was a nice release. Great size for 4 - 6 servings for a small dinner party. The pan didn't sit perfectly into the Instant Pot trivet with the handles up but it wasn't much to balancing it. I wanted the handles up so that it would be easy to remove the trivet and the pan from the instant Pot. I imagine if a pot was bought with it's own trivet it would sit on it better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made My First Cheesecake Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the first spring-form pan I've ever purchased and I just made my first cheesecake with it. It worked really well. I did have some trouble with the crust sticking a bit to the bottom, so will use parchment next time. The pan arrived with an unexpected cleaning cloth and a nice note from the seller. I would order this again.
customer_reviews.author: P_Haag

customer_reviews.title: Perfect instant pot springform
customer_reviews.text: Made my first instant pot cheesecake last night...it came out perfect. This pan was super easy to use, it had no leaks, it opened easy and it was easy to clean. I purchased this particular springform pan based on the positive reviews...it did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: krista f.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks! Cheap stuff. AVOID.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for baking. Unfortunately, even thick liquids or pastes like cake mix leaks. The seal is not very strong. Will return product. I suggest you avoid this project unless you only plan to use it to make dry/solid items.
customer_reviews.author: JamesBond007

customer_reviews.title: Fits in the 8quart instant pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 7 inch to fit inside of my 8 quart instant pot and it fit! I used it to make a cheese cake in the instant pot and overall worked well. I will say that the metal "clip" to seal the springform is already starting to show rust after using once and washing afterwards. I am a little nervous to use again without removing the rust that formed
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, short height of pan.
customer_reviews.text: Overall really nice quality pan. Used it many times as I made a bunch of cheesecakes this time of year in my IP. Only thing I disliked, the height of the pan. Most of my recipes I have to cut back on a little because it will overfill the pan. I have one other pan from a different company that I don’t have this issue with because its wall is a whole inch higher. So if your cheesecakes have a lot of filling or you build the crust high up the sides, be careful, you may make too much and overfill or waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the spring form clip did not hold the bottom of the pan in place. It arrived with the bottom 'floating' in the box and I tried a number of times to make the clip work. I'm sure the company makes good products and I just happened to receive the one that didn't work, but am returning it to Amazon today.
customer_reviews.author: vegaslady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for instant pot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use in my instant pot to make cheesecake for Thanksgiving day. Since then I have used it several times in my instant pot. Easy to clean and fits perfectly. Makes the perfect sized cakes for a family of 5. Would recommend, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine H

customer_reviews.title: Well made but leaks
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's user error, but it isn't completely water proof. Tried to make a frittata and the egg leaked a little bit through the seam where the bottom pan meets the outer wall. My mistake if this wasn't meant to be leak proof but it does recommend making egg dishes.
customer_reviews.author: MikexLL

customer_reviews.title: Everything about the order was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: First off - I couldn’t be happier with the timeliness of this order! Thank you to the seller for that! And they even included a nice washcloth to go with it! How nice! Second - I used this the very day I received it to make a peanut butter cheesecake. Couldn’t have turned out better. In part because I followed the recipe right, haha, and also because I had the perfect pan. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Luther

customer_reviews.title: Good for cheesecakes, but rolled lip holds water and rusts
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my instant pot for making cheesecakes. After the 2nd use i washed it thoroughly and shook out as much water as I could and put it in the dish strainer. next day i went to put it away and a bunch of rusty water came out of it all over my shirt. I'm very displeased that it has rusted after only 2 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Melberg

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I had to unfortunately give 1 star for each category. I used this pan for a cheesecake and the base stuck to the pan. I used another pan (calphalon) the same day and guess what....my base is intact. If I could return it, I would! Save your money and buy something else. Oh and the size is deceiving and if I returned it, there would be a fee so it was a waste of money and time to return it. Cheaper isn't better in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Good pan
customer_reviews.text: Used for instant pot 6 qt. Works well for the 4 times I’ve used it. I use parchment base and butter sides but the pan is well coated and sleeked finish. Only some butter leaks out the base. Wash and dry after using for better care. Don’t put in the dish washer like I did or it will have a bit of rust but I just wiped it off from the creases.
customer_reviews.author: Annalysia

customer_reviews.title: Unable to realign and close
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I was very disappointed with it. It looked great but once I opened it while giving a thorough washing I tried a hour and a half and never got the sucker back together. However all the other products I bought, strainer, double broiler and pot and I absolutely love all of that.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ann Baragar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my instant pot!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 7 inch and it was so perfect for my 6 quart instapot! Purchased this to make my first cheesecake in my instapot & it was perfect! Good quality, so easy to clean and perfect fit.. it doesn’t get any better! High recommend this product. I have also used it for lasagna in my instapot & it worked so great as well. Very versatile pan
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Santos

customer_reviews.title: After opening, the bottom didn't fit back in
customer_reviews.text: This was awful, whether it was a one time problem or just a bad pan in general. I opened the side to remove the bottom and rinse everything. Then the expandable ring wouldn't go back to the original shape, the bottom wouldn't fit and it leaked. Bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Ozmatoo

customer_reviews.title: Leaks with liquids inside.
customer_reviews.text: This pan leaks when trying to make egg bakes or casseroles in it. I got this for my instant pot to make egg casseroles, the eggs leak out and make a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed purchase!
customer_reviews.text: First time was fine but when I used it for the second time, it started leaking. I tried multiple times to fix it and lock again and again but it didn’t work. I bought it because it had such amazing reviews and I hate to write this but I am very disappointed and upset with this purchase. Can I get refund on this please?
customer_reviews.author: Loveleen Anand

customer_reviews.title: Really leakproof
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my favorite cheesecake, which has only a dusting of crumbs for a crust. None of the filling leaked out during baking and, best of all, the cheesecake released easily and completely from the side and bottom. Plus it was incredibly easy to clean afterward. On a separate note, I must say that I appreciated the personal note included with my order. It nice to be reminded in such a gentle way that not all the products we buy are made by large, impersonal corporations. I am proud to own and use a product made by a small company that obviously cares about what they make, and who uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane S. Freed

customer_reviews.title: Great Instant Pot Accessory
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one to make an Instant Pot cheesecake. It is a great pan and fits in both my 6-quart and 8-quart models. I liked it so much I purchased a second one so I can prepare two desserts at the same time, and a third pan was just purchased for my daughter-in-law. Cheesecake and flourless chocolate cake both turn out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CST

customer_reviews.title: Good for making cakes or cheesecakes
customer_reviews.text: Good for making cakes or cheesecakes. However I bought this specifically for making flan. The product description said leakproof, but any thin mixtures will leak right through. Made a terrible mess because I assumed it would work. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice small pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6qt instapot. It’s a little small. If you are buying this for an instapot buy a 7 inch. But if you want a smaller cake this is perfect. Also came with cut out parchment paper for the bottom which makes clean up super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda DeVincentz

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an instant pot lasagna recipe that called for a 7 inch springform pan. When I first saw the pan, I thought that it would be too small but I followed the amounts on the recipe and it was exactly the right size. The lasagna came cleanly out of the pan when it was done. I am getting a pan for my son since his 18 month old twins loved it. I will be trying my first cheesecake since I have a pan that I like and fits my 6 quart pot.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Too shallow, and not leakproof!
customer_reviews.text: I guess people have different definitions of "leak proof" because this one certainly isn't! It's also way too shallow for just about anything, which is my fault for not looking at the dementions. Already tossed the packaging, so hopefully I'll find some use for it.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Hmm
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t see any “don’t stick this in the dishwasher” notes, so I went ahead and did so before first use. It rusted immediately. I should have known better, I know, but still.
customer_reviews.author: Seoh

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Structure seems fine, and didn't leak when I cooked cheesecake! :) But when I pulled it out of the dishwasher the first time, there were already little rust spots. Kind of disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: but I decided to just go with it and I am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, when I opened the box, I was a little surprised at how small a 7" pan actually was, but I decided to just go with it and I am glad I did! I love the pan and it even comes with a microfiber cleaning cloth. I made my first EVER cheesecake from scratch in my new IP and it came out perfectly. The pan cleaned very easily and I am now hooked on making my own cheesecakes in this nifty little pan.
customer_reviews.author: hipgrammy

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure to line with parchment
customer_reviews.text: Works great although not quite leakproof unless lined with parchment paper
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Good overall but not too big, I bought to make a lasagna but was nowhere near big enough
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: leaky
customer_reviews.text: I paid extra shipping fee because I really need a springform pan in one day to bake a cheesecake. After I pour the cheesecake liquid mix in, it leaked from the bottom immediately. I have used many springform pan before for cheesecake and other cases and never met this before. My whole plan was ruined since I did not have time to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: HEMHEM

product_meta.title: Hiware 7 Inch Non-stick Springform Pan/Cheesecake Pan/Leakproof Cake Pan with 50 Pcs Parchment Paper - Accessories for Instant Pot 6, 8 Qt Pressure Cooker
feature_bullets: VERSATILE FOR INSTANT POT. Our 7-inch springform pan is perfect and widely used for instant pot 6Qt or 8Qt pressure cookers. It is an indispensable baking partner in the stove and oven (oven safe to 450℉) , helping you make flawless, delicious food with the right equipment.

HEALTHY COATING. The Non-stick coating is a food grade safety coating with no harsh chemicals or hazardous substances. The true double layer coating allows the cake be easily removed without damage. Avoid making it difficult to clean the cake because it sticks to the pan or leaves a lot of cake residue.

THE STAINLESS SPRINGFORM BUCKLE PROVIDES SMOOTH, EASY RELEASE. The stainless steel springform buckle has been upgraded which is stronger and easier to switch but will not fall off or crack, allowing the cake to be pulled out perfectly with little effort.

INCLUDE 50 PIECES OF PARCHMENT PAPER. If you are a fan of traditional baking, congratulations, the parchment paper will bring back the traditional baking experience. To prevent the cake from sticking to the chassis, combine with other designs to remove the perfect cake while also sucking away excess oil, less oil means less fat and better health.

MAKING IT YOUR FAVOURITE BAKING TOOL. Now this is the proven choice in restaurant and bakery kitchens and is also the best gadget for DIY desserts and food if you love baking stuff like cheese cake, yogurt cake, mousse, coffee cake, lasagna, quiche, paella, cookies, fruit pie, pecan pie and any similar recipe. And it also makes a great and practical gift for your friends.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,954 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
